page.title: 16Abergele Hospital
page.content: The Abergele Chest Hospital was originally built by the Manchester Corporation for their children suffering from T.B. The hospital has 100 beds, 5 consultants, 2 senior house officers, 1 registrar, 90 nurse, 14 night staff. Domestic staff, engineers etc. Abergele Hospital is part of the acute unit comprising hospitals at Glan Clwyd, St. Asaph and Holywell. The Abergele Hospital is especially renowned for its Chest, athritic and orthopeadic dept. The hospital theatre has recently been upgraded (Charnley Howarth Tent - germ free unit) There is a thriving League of Friends their largest contribution being a hydrotherapy pool, however it is a sign of the times that the childrens and isolation wards are closed.
